title: DONALD TRUMP CALLS B.S. ON HIS OWN LIE
authors: Condé Nast, Tina Nguye, Nick Bilton, Matt Kapp, Tina Nguyen, Eric Lutz
content:
On Friday morning , after a week of constant drubbing by the press , Donald Trump did the unthinkable and admitted that he had made a mistake .
On Wednesday , Trump generated what would have been a major scandal for a lesser candidate when he claimed to have seen “ top secret ” footage of the $ 400 million cash payment the Obama administration was recently reported to have airlifted to the Iranian government on the same day the Islamic Republic released four American prisoners . Trump immediately cast the money transfer , which was publicly disclosed back in January , as a hostage payment to a terrorism-sponsoring government . “ We paid $ 400 million for the hostages , ” Trump said , according to CNN . “ Such a bad precedent was set by Obama . ”
The money was , supposedly , Iran ’ s cash in the first place : the $ 400 million was paid to the U.S. by the deposed Shah of Iran in order to buy fighter jets . The U.S. froze those assets when the Shah was deposed in 1979 , but paid the $ 400 million back to the current government as part of the 2015 nuclear deal . But Trump went further then just casting the exchange as something sinister : he insisted that he had seen a video of the plane carrying the cash to Iran .
“ I ’ ll never forget the scene this morning , ” Trump said Wednesday , describing the alleged footage in detail . “ Iran―I don ’ t think you ’ ve heard this anywhere but here―Iran provided all of that footage , the tape , of taking that money off that airplane . ”
The Iranians “ have a perfect tape , obviously done by a government camera , and the tape is of the people taking the money off the plane , ” Trump continued . “ It ’ s a military tape . It ’ s a tape that was a perfect angle , nice and steady. ” The Iranian government released the tape , he claimed , “ so that we will be embarrassed . ”
After some panicked speculation in the media that the video Trump had seen might have been part of the classified intelligence briefings that both presidential candidates are now receiving , a campaign spokeswoman on Thursday told The Washington Post that Trump had “ merely [ seen ] the b-roll footage included in every broadcast ” of a specific Fox News clip . ( Despite her admission , Trump repeated his previous claim at a Maine rally shortly afterwards . )
Two days after Trump first described watching a video that he apparently imagined in great detail , the Republican presidential nominee abruptly changed course and admitted that the video he ’ d seen was widely-circulated news footage of the plane carrying the U.S. hostages in Geneva .
In campaign as fact-averse as Trump ’ s has been , the acknowledgement , however unapologetic , of basic reality seems like the dawning of a new era . That , combined with his newly reinvigorated thank you tour on Twitter , where he has hardly stopped expressing gratitude in recent days to his supporters , makes it seem like Trump ’ s latest “ pivot , ” which has never quite stuck , may be as simple as acting like a normal human being , capable of recognizing facts and being nice to fellow humans . We ’ ll see how long it lasts .
